Pre-Game Insights: Freddie Freeman's son, Charlie Freeman, expressed excitement about the World Series.
This will be the 12th Dodgers-Yankees matchup and the first in 43 years.
The League Championship Series had the highest U.S. TV ratings since 2017.
The World Series will feature five MVPs: Shohei Ohtani, Freddie Freeman, Mookie Betts, Aaron Judge, and Giancarlo Stanton.
This will be the first Series with a pair of 50-home run hitters in Judge (58) and Ohtani (54).
This is just the fifth World Series since the Wild Card Era started in 1995 involving the teams with the best records in each league.
Players practiced in 85-degree weather at Dodger Stadium.
Freddie Freeman, slowed by a bad ankle, insisted he will be in the lineup for the opener.
The Dodgers are seeking their eighth title and second in five years.
The Yankees are in the World Series for the first time since winning No. 27 in 2009.
Aaron Boone and Dave Roberts rekindle their decades-old rivalry from their college days.
Dodgers starter Jack Flaherty will start the opener against the Yankees' Gerrit Cole.
Yankees owner Hal Steinbrenner recalls the 1977 Yankees-Dodgers World Series showdown.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The rivalry between the Dodgers and Yankees dates back to 1941.
The World Series is generating significant global interest, particularly from Japan due to Shohei Ohtani.
The Yankees and Dodgers are considered the most followed and visible teams on a global scale.
This World Series is being described as the starriest in decades, if not ever.
Hal Steinbrenner shared his memories of the 1977 Yankees-Dodgers World Series.
